title: Landscape

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of oil on canvas.

credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Sigmund W. Kunstadter in memory of Sigmund W. Kunstadter
publication_history:
The Art Institute of Chicago Annual Report (1977–1978), p. 32 (ill.).

A. James Speyer and Courtney Graham Donnell, Twentieth-Century European Paintings (Chicago: University of Chicago Press, 1980), p. 55, no. 2G3.

Joann Moser, Jean Metzinger in Retrospective, exh. cat. (Iowa City, Iowa: The University of Iowa Museum of Art, 1985), pp. 45 and 90–91, cat. 140 (ill.).
exhibition_history:
Grosse Berliner Kunstausstellung, 1926, cat. 1758. 

Berlin, Galerie Alfred Flechtheim, Nell Walden–Heimann und Ihre Sammlungen, September 6–September 23, 1927, p. 9, cat. 99.

Bern, Kunstmuseum, Gemälde und Zeichnungen alter Meister Kunsthandwerk aus Privatbesitz: Der Sturm, Sammlung Nell Walden aus den Jahren 1912–1920, October 1944–March 1945, p. 56, cat. 351.

Stockholm, Riksförbundet för Bildande Konst, Der Sturm: Samling Nell Walden, 1954, p. 18, cat. 60.

Iowa City, The University of Iowa Museum of Art, Jean Metzinger in Retrospective, August 31–October 13, 1985 no. 140; traveled to Austin, Archer M. Huntington Art Gallery, University of Texas, November 2–December 28, 1985; and Chicago, David and Alfred Smart Gallery, University of Chicago, January18–September  3, 1986.
provenance_text: Nell Walden (1887–1975), Berlin by at least Sept. 23, 1927 to at least 1954 [Berlin 1927 and Stockholm 1954]. Probably Otto Gerson Gallery, New York, by 1962 [this and the following according to correspondence in curatorial file]; Marlborough-Gerson, Inc., New York and London [verso label]; sold to Sigmund Kunstadter (died 1977), Highland Park, IL; by descent to Mrs. Sigmund Kunstadter, Highland Park, IL, 1977; given to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1977.
